image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: (Brother of Kenneth Salazar), a Representative from Colorado; born in Alamosa, Alamosa County, Colo., July 21, 1953; B.S., Adams State College, Alamosa, Colo., 1981; United States Army, 1973-1976; farmer; rancher; business owner; member of the Colorado Agricultural Commission, 1999-2002; member of the Colorado state house of representatives, 2003-2004; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Ninth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "John Salazar" in Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.

researchRecord.name: In the Southwest Colorado Political Campaign Materials, 1928-ongoing, 6 linear feet.
